summary: This document is a set of responses to administrative questions regarding staffing, inmate population, and operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated around August 2019. It provides detailed statistics on authorized vs. onboard staff numbers, correctional officer counts, salaries, inmate population data, and specific staffing for the shifts covering August 9-10, 2019.

keyFacts: As of August 3, 2019, MCC New York had 253 authorized staff positions with 213 actually onboard, indicating a staffing shortage.
For the shifts covering the night of August 9-10, 2019, MCC New York was slightly understaffed: 20 of 21 posts filled on Friday night, and 18 of 19 posts filled on Saturday morning.
The entry-level salary for a Correctional Officer at MCC New York was GS-5 $48,162 or GS-6 $50,790.
MCC New York uses both augmentation and overtime to address staffing shortages, but detailed breakdowns require significant research.
The facility did not request additional Correctional Officer positions in the relevant fiscal year, but was provided with 25 additional P01A positions.
